12092326703209018224.Text: The Devil Dagoth Ur is dead, and all his kin. And the Blight has gone, too, and the skies are blue over Red Mountain.

1703220502371112246.Text: The Devil Dagoth Ur is dead, and all his kin. And the Blight has gone, too, and the skies are blue over Red Mountain.

1926254563774775.Text: It is the Hour of Wakening. He comes forth in his glory, and his people shall rejoice, and his enemies shall scatter like dust.

759714111504811569.Text: He is the Lord, and Father of the Mountain. He sleeps, but when he wakes, we shall rise from our dreams, shall sweep our land clean of the n'wah. Why have you denied him? As Lord Dagoth has said. 'All shall greet him as flesh, or as dust.'

945742012895524878.Text: He is the Lord, and Father of the Mountain. He sleeps, but when he wakes, we shall rise from our dreams, shall sweep our land clean of the n'wah. Why have you denied him? As Lord Dagoth has said. 'All shall greet him as flesh, or as dust.'

72121090102358916.Text: He will not come to you, Lord Nerevar. It is you who must beg forgiveness. Go to him, beneath Red Mountain, kneel before him, and he will show you mercy.

6188310802152324078.Text: He was a god, and now he is dead. IF one can truly kill a god.

30723317541296328471.Text: Dagoth Ur is the former Lord High Councilor of House Dagoth. He was of Lord Nerevar's generation, older than we, and a mighty sorcerer and enchanted in life. In his sustained shadow immortality, he appears to be a highly intelligent, severely deluded immortal monster with unparalleled supernatural abilities. He appears, by turns, lucid and deranged, compassionate and bestial, profoundly wise and profoundly disordered. In short, he is a mad god.

141337634473732608.Text: He will not come to you, Lord Nerevar. It is you who must beg forgiveness. Go to him, beneath Red Mountain, kneel before him, and he will show you mercy.

2839546141966526654.Text: He will not come to you, Lord Nerevar. It is you who must beg forgiveness. Go to him, beneath Red Mountain, kneel before him, and he will show you mercy.

8854268012120316016.Text: He will not come to you, Lord Nerevar. It is you who must beg forgiveness. Go to him, beneath Red Mountain, kneel before him, and he will show you mercy.

2179888502916522054.Text: He will not come to you, Lord Nerevar. It is you who must beg forgiveness. Go to him, beneath Red Mountain, kneel before him, and he will show you mercy.

17054195752231524292.Text: He will not come to you, Lord Nerevar. It is you who must beg forgiveness. Go to him, beneath Red Mountain, kneel before him, and he will show you mercy.

2055925951363514623.Text: So long as the Ordinators, Buoyant Armigers, and Tribunal could contain the blight and Dagoth Ur's creatures within the Ghostfence, faith in the Temple's protective power was strong. But now travelers and settlements suffer from blight storms and marauding monsters, and the people fear the Temple is losing its ages-old battle with the Devil Dagoth Ur.

14148643117627102.Text: Dagoth Ur is the Awakened Lord of the Sixth House, come to cast down false gods, drive foreigners from the land, and restore the ancient glory of Morrowind. He bids you come to Red Mountain. For the friendship and honor that once you shared, he would grant you counsel and power, if only you would pledge that friendship anew. The path to Red Mountain is long, and filled with danger, but if you are worthy, you will find there wisdom, a firm friend, and all the power you need to set the world aright.

272538181106332984.Text: He is the Lord, and Father of the Mountain. He wakes, and the land wakes with him. All the land, and all of its people, shall rise from sleep, and sweep the land clean of the n'wah. Why have you denied him? As Lord Dagoth has said. "All shall greet him as flesh, or as dust."

870214545525920274.Text: He is the Lord, and Father of the Mountain. He wakes, and the land wakes with him. All the land, and all of its people, shall rise from sleep, and sweep the land clean of the n'wah. Why have you denied him? As Lord Dagoth has said. "All shall greet him as flesh, or as dust."

12386198611142525550.Text: He is the Lord, and Father of the Mountain. He wakes, and the land wakes with him. All the land, and all of its people, shall rise from sleep, and sweep the land clean of the n'wah. Why have you denied him? As Lord Dagoth has said. "All shall greet him as flesh, or as dust."

826279552648327963.Text: It is the Hour of Wakening. He comes forth in his glory, and his people shall rejoice, and his enemies shall scatter like dust.

376225401195419838.Text: So, %PCName. Dagoth Ur and all his kin are dead. You know. You slew them with your own hand, and the Blight is gone from Morrowind. And it would be very nice if they were to stay dead, forever, this time around. But I am a historian, and so I am a pessimist. I hope we will not grow too complacent.

645884282651816915.Text: Dagoth Ur was the leader of the extinct Sixth House, House Dagoth, the traitor house destroyed in the War of the First Council. Dagoth Ur is the evil immortal enemy of the Tribunal Temple cult. The Temple blames Dagoth Ur and his hosts for all the evils that beset the Dunmer and Morrowind. Dagoth Ur dwells in fiery caverns beneath Red Mountain, served by his kin and legions of monsters.

2979541872896416232.Text: The Devil Dagoth Ur is dead, and all his kin. And the Blight has gone, too, and the skies are blue over Red Mountain.

2763228473502270.Text: Dagoth Ur is the evil immortal enemy of the Tribunal Temple cult. The Temple blames Dagoth Ur and his hosts for all the evils that beset the Dunmer and Morrowind. Dagoth Ur dwells in fiery caverns beneath Red Mountain, served by his kin and legions of monsters.

7697310882861119359.Text: You have slain Dagoth Ur and all his kin. But remember, %PCName. Once before, Lord Nerevar thought Dagoth Ur and all his kin were dead.

20394262321576022436.Text: Dagoth Ur is the Devil and the Enemy. Dagoth Ur and his beasts and servants are the source of many evils that beset the Dunmer and Morrowind. Dagoth Ur dwells in fiery caverns beneath Red Mountain, served by his kin, called ash vampires, and by legions of deformed monsters.
